basics.name: Isaac Rankin
basics.label: PhD Student in Statistics
basics.summary: PhD student in Statistics at the University of British Columbia, focusing on developing and applying advanced probabilistic methods to challenging problems in computational chemistry and drug discovery. Co-President of the Statistics Graduate Student Association (SGSA).

location.address: Department of Statistics, 3182 Earth Sciences Building, 2207 Main Mall, UBC

work.name: ALVITUR Analytics and Data Solutions
work.summary: Providing client-tailored statistical consulting and data solutions.
highlights: FFAW-Unifor: Developed mapping software, designed a quota allocation algorithm for the snow crab fishery, automated reporting pipelines, analyzed a bycatch mitigation experiment, and analyzed vessel satellite data to investigate the Atlantic cod collapse. Created a novel light-intensity proxy for redfish catch. This work is leading to three co-authored manuscripts.
Devinci Cycles: Web-scraped inventory data of retailers and competitor brands to improve cash flow by predicting the optimal arrival and quantity of SKUs.
Chinook Business Advisory: Building a suite of computational tools to automate company valuations and feasibility analyses, streamlining mergers and acquisitions processes.

work.name: Outlier AI
work.position: Freelance AI Mathematics Domain Expertise Developer
work.summary: Applied various forms of supervised and reinforcement learning to improve AI models in mathematics, increasing model accuracy across analytic tasks.

work.name: Lightricity Ltd.
work.summary: Developed Python algorithms to optimize photovoltaic cell test equipment. Delivered user-friendly analytic tools for cross-functional teams, accelerating product development and improving decision-making efficiency.
highlights: Achieved a 43% improvement in light uniformity by reducing variance in the illumination distribution, guiding the development of next-generation products.

work.name: Mountain City Cycle
work.summary: Led store operations and supervised a team of 10 during periods of vacation coverage. Improved operational efficiencies by managing inventory and reducing overhead expenses.
highlights: Delivered expert customer service by handling sales, providing repair quotes, and performing bicycle maintenance as a certified mechanic.

volunteer.summary: Contributed to the ACE, BE-FIT, and ECHO studies by cleaning clinical trial data, constructing tables, performing a social network analysis, modelling patient outcomes, and interpreting model results.
highlights: These analyses support the studies to develop cancer rehabilitation programs, ultimately to improve the well-being of cancer survivors.
Research will result in two co-authorships (ACE and ECHO) and one acknowledgment (BE-FIT).

volunteer.summary: Investigated eye patch ratio as a biomarker of orca whale health and analyzed maternal and grand-maternal effects on survival in the northern resident population.
highlights: This project will contribute to a better understanding of the effects that impact orca survival and will help shape conservation policy.

volunteer.summary: Mentored high school athletes on the mountain bike team, coaching leadership, discipline, and teamwork while preparing for the provincial championships.
Contribute regularly to trail maintenance days. Volunteer for course marshalling and timing for community bike races.

highlights: Improved the sensitivity and accuracy of the Python package PoseBusters in detecting physically implausible molecules.
Sports & Gym Officer, Green Templeton College. MSc cohort EDI Representative, Department of Statistics.
